Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base, convex sides, small roll rim and three triangular lug handles on the shoulder. Exterior is decorated in red-brown paint with wavy lines. Three parallel wavy lines runs below the rim, 7 concentric wavy lines form semicircles between the handles, and two sets of double wavy lines arc across the lower body.
Curator's comments: Shape and some design motifs most similar to Decorated Ware D59p in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery
Condition: fair, base shows signs of wear.
